background.text:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1. This is an application under Sec. 438 of Cr.P.C. for grant of anticipatory bail. 
2. Read application. After perusal of record it appears that on the allegations of Pramod Sandbhor C.R.No. 645/2018 has been registered against the applicant and co-accused Tejas Salve under Sec. 326, 323, 504, 506 r/w 34 of I.P.C. As per allegations in the F.I.R. present applicants assaulted informant by means of fist and kick blows. It appears that there are serious allegations against Tejas Salve.

arguments.text: It further appears that nothing is to be recovered from the custody of present applicants. Ld.Cousnel for the applicants filed pursis on record by contending that informant after taking treatment immediately discharged from the hospital (Exh. 6). Ld.Counsel for the applicants submitted that on the basis of the report lodged by applicant No. 3 C.R.No. 643/2018 has been registered against present informant and other four under Sec. 325, 323, 504 r/w 34 of I.P.C. as well as under Atrocities Act.

argumentSentences.text: It further appears that nothing is to be recovered from the custody of present applicants.
Ld.Cousnel for the applicants filed pursis on record by contending that informant after taking treatment immediately discharged from the hospital (Exh. 6).
Ld.Counsel for the applicants submitted that on the basis of the report lodged by applicant No. 3 C.R.No.
643/2018 has been registered against present informant and other four under Sec. 325, 323, 504 r/w 34 of I.P.C. as well as under Atrocities Act.

arguments.text: Therefore, considering the nature of the offence and allegations against the applicant, I am of the opinion that applicants are entitled for ad-interim anticipatory bail. However, interest of prosecution can be safeguarded by imposing certain conditions. Thus, following order.

argumentSentences.text: Therefore, considering the nature of the offence and allegations against the applicant, I am of the opinion that applicants are entitled for ad-interim anticipatory bail.
However, interest of prosecution can be safeguarded by imposing certain conditions.

order.text: O R D E R 1. Application Exh. 4 is hereby allowed. 2. Applicants No.(1)Pintu Gopal Salve, (2)Mahindra Gopal Salve and (3)Siddharth Mahindra Salve be enlarged on bail on furnishing P.R. bond of Rs. 15,000/- each with one surety in the like amount, in the event of their arrest in C.R.No. 645/2018 under Sec. 326, 323, 504, 506 r/w 34 of I.P.C. registered with Talegaon Dabhade Police Station. 3. They shall attend the concern police station on every Sunday and Monday between 10.00 a.m. to 12.00 noon. 4. They shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of this case. 5. If the applicants committed breach of any conditions, the prosecution is at liberty to approach this court for cancellation of the bail. 7. Issue show cause notice to the Senior P.I. of concerned Police Station and D.G.P., Pune together with the copy of this order calling upon them as to why interim pre-arrest bail should not be made absolute R/o. 28.11.2018

footer: ( S. H. Gwalani ) Dt. : 16.11.2018 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune.
processedText:
Bail Appln.No. 82/2019 CNR-MHPU01-000316-2019 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 1. This is an application under Sec. 438 of Cr.P.C. for grant of anticipatory bail. 
2. Read application. After perusal of record it appears that on the allegations of Pramod Sandbhor C.R.No. 645/2018 has been registered against the applicant and co-accused Tejas Salve under Sec. 326, 323, 504, 506 r/w 34 of I.P.C. As per allegations in the F.I.R. present applicants assaulted informant by means of fist and kick blows. It appears that there are serious allegations against Tejas Salve. 
---background-ends---
It further appears that nothing is to be recovered from the custody of present applicants. Ld.Cousnel for the applicants filed pursis on record by contending that informant after taking treatment immediately discharged from the hospital (Exh. 6). Ld.Counsel for the applicants submitted that on the basis of the report lodged by applicant No. 3 C.R.No. 643/2018 has been registered against present informant and other four under Sec. 325, 323, 504 r/w 34 of I.P.C. as well as under Atrocities Act. 
---argument-ends---
Therefore, considering the nature of the offence and allegations against the applicant, I am of the opinion that applicants are entitled for ad-interim anticipatory bail. However, interest of prosecution can be safeguarded by imposing certain conditions. Thus, following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1. Application Exh. 4 is hereby allowed. 2. Applicants No.(1)Pintu Gopal Salve, (2)Mahindra Gopal Salve and (3)Siddharth Mahindra Salve be enlarged on bail on furnishing P.R. bond of Rs. 15,000/- each with one surety in the like amount, in the event of their arrest in C.R.No. 645/2018 under Sec. 326, 323, 504, 506 r/w 34 of I.P.C. registered with Talegaon Dabhade Police Station. 3. They shall attend the concern police station on every Sunday and Monday between 10.00 a.m. to 12.00 noon. 4. They shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of this case. 5. If the applicants committed breach of any conditions, the prosecution is at liberty to approach this court for cancellation of the bail. 7. Issue show cause notice to the Senior P.I. of concerned Police Station and D.G.P., Pune together with the copy of this order calling upon them as to why interim pre-arrest bail should not be made absolute R/o. 28.11.2018 
---order-ends---
( S. H. Gwalani ) Dt. : 16.11.2018 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune.
